steps.title: Guided tour
steps.message: Welcome to geppetto! geppetto is an open-source platform built by engineers, scientists, and other hackers to simulate complex biological systems and their surrounding environment.This is an early access development release.

steps.title: Geppetto Projects
steps.message: A project in Geppetto can have multiple experiments, and only one experiment can be made active at a time. What you see now is an active experiment

steps.title: Simulation Controls
steps.message: Above this window you can find Simulation Controls, with them you can run/play/pause/stop an experiment.

steps.title: Camera Controls
steps.message: To the left of the screen, you'll find the camera controls. With this you can move around the scene, zoom in/out, and rotate the camera.

steps.title: Console
steps.message: The console allows you to control the experiment via commands as an alternative to the simulation controls.

steps.title: Experiments Table
steps.message: The experiments table displays all the experiments within the loaded project. A click on a row show more information about the experiment.

steps.title: Experiments Table
steps.message: Icons on the right side of the table allow for; setting an experiment active, downloading an experiment's model and results, deleting/cloning the experiment.

steps.title: Experiments Table
steps.message: Within the experiments table, you can have access to all the experiments within the loaded project.

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: The control panel allows for navigating variables and objects within an experiment.

steps.title: Search
steps.message: Pressing this button brings up a window where you can search variables and objects within Geppetto.

steps.title: Help
steps.message: To get more information about Geppetto, launch the help window located above this window. In it you'll find more detailed documentation on how to use Geppetto.

steps.title: Open Tutorial Again
steps.message: At anytime you wish to re-do this tutorial, look for the button with the same icon as the one in this window. It will start it again.

steps.title: End of Guided Tour
steps.message: The end of this tutorial has come, time for you to keep exploring on your own.
